jodd.db

Class DbOom

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.db.DbOom

  • public class DbOom
extends java.lang.Object
    Starting class that all DBOOM starts from. It encapsulate the database and works like a factory for all db-related classes. This way you can have multiple connections.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static DbOom get()
        Returns default DbOom instance. If multiple DbOoms are in use, an exception is thrown.

      • create

        public static DbOom.Builder create()
        Creates a new DbOom builder.

      • connect

        public DbOom connect()
        Initializes the DbOom by connecting to the database. Database will be detected and DbOom will be configured to match it.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Closes the DbOom.

      • config

        public DbOomConfig config()
        Returns DbOom configuration.

      • queryConfig

        public DbQueryConfig queryConfig()
        Returns default query configuration.

      • entityManager

        public DbEntityManager entityManager()
        Returns DbOoom entity manager.

      • sessionProvider

        public DbSessionProvider sessionProvider()
        Returns DbSession provider.

      • connectionProvider

        public ConnectionProvider connectionProvider()
        Returns connection provider.

      • queryMap

        public QueryMap queryMap()
        Returns a query map.

      • entities

        public DbEntitySql entities()
        Returns Entity SQL factory.

      • sql

        public DbSqlBuilder sql(java.lang.String sql)
        Creates new T-SQL builder.

      • sql

        public DbSqlBuilder sql()
        Creates new empty T-SQL builder.

        public DbOomQuery query(java.lang.String sql)
        Creates a query.

        Creates a query from a sql generator.
